description.narrative: The Action aims to promote sustainable economic prosperity and poverty reduction in Vietnam through improving social and environmental impacts of shrimp production and related activities in its value chain adopting life cycle assessment approach and complying to the national and global standards and regulations. The action will be implemented in the Mekong Delta area of Vietnam throughout theduration of 48 months from 03 / 2016 to 02 / 2020 with the total budget of 2,507,749. The specific objectives are: 1) ParticipatorySocial Impact Assessment (p-SIA) and Biodiversity Environment Impact Assessment (B-EIA) criteria of Aquaculture Stewardship Council(ASC) standards will be adopted by shrimp producers and CSR norms (SA8000, ASC) are practiced by shrimp processors, to minimize thesocial and environmental footprint of commercial aquaculture; 2) Vietnamese shrimp producers/SME processors have access to adequatefinance and improved production efficiency; 3) Small scale shrimp producers are empowered tohave stronger voice in negotiation withother actors in the value chain; 4) Government's credit policies targeting aquaculture/shrimp producers will be promoted and implemented effectively to support shrimp value chain development. Target groups are: i)30shrimp producer groups/associations; ii) 25 SME processors; iii) Provincial governments <(>&<)> Departments of Agriculture and Rural Development; iv) Social Policies Banks <(>&<)> Agricultural Banks Expected impacts of the Action At technical level, shrimp producers and SME processes will apply affordable technologies, appropriate management behaviour to improve farming practices toward efficient use of resources. At economic level, small scale producers/processors adopting sustainable production practices will have higher profit margin and achieve an increasing market share in European market. At social level, the Action will create transformative changes in women empowerment both at family and community level through the integration of GALS. In addition, betterrelations with surrounding communities will be achieved thanks to small-scale producers following sustainable production practices. At policy level, Government's credit and other policies on value chain development model are developed in participatory manner and implemented effectively in shrimp value chain to promote and create incentives for actors to adopt SCP approach.

participating-org.narrative: In Vietnam , Oxfam is one of the leading international, non -governmental organisation. Since 1955, Oxfam is active in Vietnam withhumanitarian interventions and started development work in the late 1980's. Today, Oxfam works in 26 provinces with people, governments and civil society to promote equality and well-being through social and economic change.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood

description.narrative: Improved policies: # cases where Oxfam contributed to national governments or global actors adopting/monitoring/implementing smallholder inclusive agribusiness investment policies, in line with social, economic and environmental responsibility standards
